title: Syncing stucked and can't be gracefully shutdown
body:
#### System information

Geth version: 1.10.14-stable
OS & Version: Linux


#### Expected behaviour
1. sync to the latest height
2. gracefully shutdown when kill with `SIGTERM` signal

#### Actual behaviour
1. the node stopped syncing in block height 13842763, (latest: 13885049), also with warn like `Failed to decode block body` like I reported in https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/issues/24158

2. I try to gracefully shut it down with `SIGTERM` signal, but it shows:


similar issue https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/issues/21273 ,  is it some new kind of deadlock?

#### Steps to reproduce the behaviour


#### Backtrace
https://gist.github.com/bitrocks/77db0474aa319839520b3808832574f5

When submitting logs: please submit them as text and not screenshots.
This happens because of double locking of `freezer.writeLock` in function `rawdb.ReadCanonicalBodyRLP`.
